thread.title: CBC awarded broadcast rights to Olympics through 2024
thread.title_full: CBC awarded broadcast rights to Olympics through 2024 | Toronto Star

author: Jackie Hong
title: CBC awarded broadcast rights to Olympics through 2024
text:
The CBC has been awarded Canadian broadcast rights to the Olympic Games through to 2024, the International Olympic Committee announced Wednesday.
The public broadcaster, which was already set to air Rio 2016, Pyeongchang 2018 and Tokyo 2020, will also be broadcasting the Beijing 2022 Winter Games and the 2024 Games, whose host city is still to be determined.
“This extension agreement is a clear recognition of the exceptional coverage CBC/Radio-Canada provided for the Sochi 2014 Olympic Winter Games – the most watched Olympics in history,” CBC/Radio-Canada President Hubert T. Lacroix said it a press release. “We are pleased that Canadians across the country will be able to continue to experience with their public broadcaster all the excitement of the Olympic Games, wherever and however they choose to cheer on our best athletes.”
In the release, IOC President Thomas Bach called the CBC a strong supporter of sports in Canada. He added that both sides have also agreed to collaborate on the Olympic Channel project, a global television channel where more than 90 per cent of generated revenue will be used to support sports at all levels around the world.
